greet: … and these are your keys, young one. That will be all! This is officially your bar now. With the energy you have, I'm sure you won't have any trouble serving customers and taking good care of the place.

Ah, the Everest, an all-time classic. 3 parts Caledon Ridge, 2 parts Gryte, poured on a big ice cube inside a rocks glass.
Don't worry, you can always check the recipe book for guidance. I left it somewhere there, under the counter.
If you mess the preparation up, you can throw the contents of the mixer into the bin, no problem. And…
If you want to prevent someone from getting too drunk, you could always water down the drink a bit. Just put the mixer under the tap water faucet.
Alrighty, let's see you prepare an Everest, young one!
leaveCorrect:
That was an excellent drink, young one! And what a fine Caledon. Take this tip, you've earned it.
I should get going now, but I wish you the best of luck with the place!
leaveWrong: Well, that tasted quite different from the Everest I'm used to. Maybe it's an innovative recipe… Don't forget to check the recipe book if you're not familiar with a cocktail.
I must get going now, but good luck with your first shift today, young one!
leaveWater: Not bad for your first drink, young one! A shame that you watered down this fine Caledon. Customers may tip less if they find out their cocktail is watered down.
It's been a pleasure talking with you, but I should get going now. Good luck with your first shift today!
